this review we feature the best portable Bluetooth speakers that you can bring

tested every single one of these speakers to ensure that they provide great
sound performance with enhanced bass, and are lightweight enough for travel
and portable listening. Apart from their sound performance, these Bluetooth
speakers are also waterproof and durable, making them ideal for outdoor

crystal clear details. If you are looking for the best portable Bluetooth

### #1 Best-Rated Portable Speaker: [Soundcore
Trance](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07YDF1WQ7/ref=as_li_qf_asin_il_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=basheaspe02-20&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07YDF1WQ7&linkId=aaee5ebda0f14ed9cdb89050e33162d2)

![Soundcore Trance Portable Speaker](https://www.bassheadspeakers.com/wp-
content/uploads/2020/03/Soundcore-Trance-Portable-Speaker.jpg)

 **Soundcore Trance Portable Bluetooth Speaker Specs:**

  *  **Wattage** : 80 watts
  *  **Battery Life** : 18 hours
  *  **Waterproof Rating** : IPX7 (fully submersible)
  *  **Bluetooth** : 5.0
  *  **Weight** : 7.72 lbs
  *  **Wireless Range** : 66 feet
  *  **Bass Radiators** : 2
  *  **Additional Features** : BassUp technology for extra bass

  
---  
 **Pros**|  **Cons**  
---|---  
✔️Loud 80 watts sound output

✔️18 hours battery life

✔️Carry handle on the top

| 🚫Takes some time to reach full charge

🚫Weighs around 8 lbs  
  
There’s nothing quite like the [Soundcore Trance
speaker](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07YDF1WQ7/ref=as_li_qf_asin_il_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=basheaspe02-20&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07YDF1WQ7&linkId=aaee5ebda0f14ed9cdb89050e33162d2).
It’s one of the best portable Bluetooth speakers we have tested, delivering up
to 101 dB of sound with deep bass and rousing melodies. The entire speaker is
powered by a front facing 5.25 inch woofer and 2 inch tweeter with passive
radiators for huge sound performance. They are the ideal speakers for outdoor
parties and barbecues where you just want to blast a huge amount of music with
bass to get the party started.

What we liked most about this speaker is that it supports BassUp technology
which uses a custom algorithm to analyse the sound signature and provide
instant bass amplification. We tried out the BassUp feature that it does work
– it adds a good amount of bass punch to this speaker, making it great for EDM
and rock music genres.

The sound quality on this speaker is nice and the volume does not distort at
maximum levels, which is really good for parties or just casual listening.
This speaker has a tonne of output power and can easily drive a party from
30-50 people without any difficulty.

The speaker is fully waterproof and you can even throw it into the pool –
while it floats on water. The entire speaker is IPX7 waterproof with tough
casing that keeps the internal components dry at all times.

There’s also a beat-driven light show which the speaker can produce. It
delivers 5 light modes that can really add to the party atmosphere and the
light modes are controllable on the Soundcore app. You can watch the LED
lights pulsate to the beat of the music, which is really fun to have.

The Soundcore Trance speaker uses the Soundcore app to control the EQ
settings. You can choose from 3 party modes, or swipe the screen to get extra
LED lightshow performances. The speaker also supports outdoor modes which
amplifiers the bass for much harder hitting music sound.

Apart from the loud sound performance, the Soundcore Trance has a built-in
battery life that delivers up to 18 hours of battery time – which is really
impressive for a portable speaker! It also supports the latest Bluetooth 5.0
for high quality music streaming.

It’s not a small speaker, weighing roughly around 8 lbs. That said, the
speaker has a tonne of power with loud volume output, and also comes with a
nice carry handle at the top for easy portability.

 **The Verdict?** If you are looking for one of the best portable Bluetooth
speakers, [go for the Soundcore Trance portable
speaker](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07YDF1WQ7/ref=as_li_qf_asin_il_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=basheaspe02-20&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07YDF1WQ7&linkId=aaee5ebda0f14ed9cdb89050e33162d2).
It’s a really powerful and heavy duty speaker that delivers 101dB of sound and
up to 80 watts of power output. While it weighs slightly heavier due to its
large frame, it has a nice portable handle at the top for you to bring it
around easily.

### #2 Best Sounding Portable Speaker: [JBL Xtreme
2](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07CVPZJTV/ref=as_li_qf_asin_il_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=basheaspe02-20&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07CVPZJTV&linkId=54f08eb080e8fa71c152eeb6fbe70f98)

![JBL Xtreme 2 Portable Speaker](https://www.bassheadspeakers.com/wp-
content/uploads/2020/03/JBL-Xtreme-2-Portable-Speaker.jpg)

 **JBL Xtreme 2 Portable Bluetooth Speaker Specs:**

  *  **Wattage** : 40 watts
  *  **Battery Life** : 15 hours
  *  **Waterproof Rating** : IPX7 (fully submersible)
  *  **Bluetooth** : 5.0
  *  **Weight** : 5.3 lbs
  *  **Wireless Range** : 66 feet
  *  **Bass Radiators** : 2
  *  **Additional Features** : Supports JBL Connect+ app

  
---  
 **Pros**|  **Cons**  
---|---  
✔️Powerful deep bass performance

✔️IPX7 waterproof and portable

✔️Carry-on strap included

| 🚫Slightly pricey speaker

🚫Does not support true wireless stereo  
  
The [JBL Xtreme
2](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07CVPZJTV/ref=as_li_qf_asin_il_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=basheaspe02-20&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07CVPZJTV&linkId=54f08eb080e8fa71c152eeb6fbe70f98),
an upgraded version of the JBL Xtreme speaker, is definitely one of the best
portable Bluetooth speakers you can find. This speaker has one of the best
sound signatures that we have tested so far, deliver everything from crystal
clear highs to detailed midranges and stunning bass. This speaker has a built-
in battery that delivers up to 15 hours of playtime on a single charge, and is
IPX7 waterproof for outdoor activities by the pool or beach.

We were very impressed with the sound quality, versatility, design and
portability of the Xtreme 2. It is a relatively large speaker but with a
portable design, and we found it easy to carry around with the included carry
on strap.

The sound quality on the Xtreme 2 is superb – one of the best we have heard.
It has pretty impressive range and especially nice clear bass response that
really feels tight and punchy. The bass is impactful and does not muddy into
any of the midrange frequencies. They are great for EDM and pop music genres
where the vocals, bass and beats can really shine through. This is a speaker
that is definitely worth listening to.

The only downside that we found from this upgrade was that the Xtreme 2 lacks
the ability to daisy chain – as with all JBL Connect+ speakers. While this
speaker will pair wirelessly to your smartphone device without any
difficulties, we found that the Connect+ app not really user-friendly and
sometimes unclear to use. You can also adjust the EQ settings on the app,
although it doesn’t come with a volume or EQ indicator within the app.

Surprisingly, the Xtreme 2 is highly portable despite weighing a huge 2.4 kg.
It comes with a portable strap that you can use to carry the speaker on your
shoulder. The built-in battery also works like a charm, delivering a grand
total of 15 hours of playtime on a single charge. That’s a lot of power built
into a portable speaker with such loud volume output.

While JBL doesn’t publish how many watts the Xtreme 2 has, we know that the
Xtreme 2 is powered by an internal amp that delivers 10 watts to each speaker
driver – meaning that it has 40 watts RMS total power. This is roughly as loud
as the JBL Boombox on battery mode (the Boombox has 60 watts RMS when
connected to AC power).

What we particularly loved about the Xtreme 2 is the dual side firing woofers
that come with the speakers. These passive-subs vibrate and move to the beat
of the music, and you can literally feel the bass coming from these side
radiators. This portable speaker has some of the best bass you’ll ever hear in
a portable speaker, and works great for barbecues, parties and outdoor
camping.

 **The Verdict?** The [JBL Xtreme 2 is hands down one of the best portable
Bluetooth
speakers](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07CVPZJTV/ref=as_li_qf_asin_il_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=basheaspe02-20&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07CVPZJTV&linkId=54f08eb080e8fa71c152eeb6fbe70f98)
with 40 watts RMS power and 15 hours of battery life. This thing gets
incredibly loud with deep bass tones and details, and has some of the best
sound quality we have heard from a portable speaker. Furthermore, this speaker
is IPX7 waterproof and can be control via the JBL Connect+ app which you can
download from the app store. While this portable speaker doesn’t come cheap,
it has really versatile features and we highly recommend them for music
lovers.

### #3 Best Budget Portable Speaker: [VTIN
R4](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07QYXK9S4/ref=as_li_qf_asin_il_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=basheaspe02-20&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07QYXK9S4&linkId=ff2a8f4d012c5d6b619ff15fe9b9788f)

If you are looking for a purely budget portable speaker, [go for the VTIN R4
Bluetooth
speaker](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07QYXK9S4/ref=as_li_qf_asin_il_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=basheaspe02-20&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07QYXK9S4&linkId=ff2a8f4d012c5d6b619ff15fe9b9788f).
This small, compact and portable speaker is built to deliver quality music
output, and has actually more volume and bass than we thought it would have.
Furthermore, the R4 speaker is equipped with the latest Bluetooth 5.0 for high
quality wireless Bluetooth streaming with a more stable connection. If you are
on a tight budget and want to get a portable speaker that won’t disappoint,
the VTIN R4 is probably your answer.

One thing that stands out with the VTIN R4 speaker is that, despite is small
and compact design, it comes with a built-in battery that delivers a whopping
24 hours of music playtime. It’s great for outdoor activities and can also be
used to charge your mobile device on the go. The speaker is designed to be
lightweight and durable, and can be easily hand carried or attached to your
backpack on the go.

The speaker itself comes with 10W drivers and a HD stereo radiator. This
allows the speaker to deliver crisp sound with a measure of stereo separation
which we liked. Music performances especially vocals were presented accurately
with little distortion at maximum volume levels.

Furthermore, the VTIN R4 speaker is designed to be IPX5 waterproof which
resists water sprays, dust and sand. It is durable enough to adapt to outdoor
environments, and you can take this speaker for swimming, beach parties or
harsh environments whether it rains or not.

It also comes with a lanyard which you can use to attach to your backpack.
Apart from wireless Bluetooth 5.0, this portable speaker also supports TF card
inputs – so you’d be able to play music even without wireless Bluetooth
functionality.

 **The Verdict?** If you are looking for one of the best portable Bluetooth
speakers on a budget, [go for the VTIN R4
speaker](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07QYXK9S4/ref=as_li_qf_asin_il_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=basheaspe02-20&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07QYXK9S4&linkId=ff2a8f4d012c5d6b619ff15fe9b9788f).
This speaker delivers crystal clear sound, detailed midranges and powerful
bass despite its small size. We were pretty much surprised at how loud these
speakers straight out of the box in full stereo blast mode – producing clear
details with virtually no distortion.
